intro: Armeria montcaunica, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus. It belongs to the family Cariophyllaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit. The plant features dense clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early summer. Its leaves are typically blue-green, hairy, and arranged in a rosette pattern. Armeria montcaunica thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in alpine or subalpine environments.
